alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 11:30AM EDT until July 18 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN BOYD, LAWRENCE AND NORTHWESTERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 1130 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain from earlier thunderstorms. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Louisa, Wayne, Blaine, Yatesville Lake State Park, Fort Gay, Burnaugh, Centerville, Durbin, East Lynn Lake, Webbville, Fallsburg, Buchanan, Gallup, Genoa, Glenhayes, Lockwood, Clifford, East Lynn and Houckville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
